intro: Nephrolepis biserrata, commonly known as the serrated maidenhair fern, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically arching and gracefully drooping. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori on the undersides of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires consistent humidity to flourish. Nephrolepis biserrata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and ability to thrive in indoor conditions.
